Metadata.Title: How to Choose Between Snk Files And Pfx Files Sign An Assembly With A Strong Name
Metadata.DirectLink: How to Choose Between Snk Files And Pfx Files Sign An Assembly With A Strong Name

Content.Data:
Description

If you do not use delay-signing, use password-protected .pfx files to help protect your private key. Visual Studio includes support for .pfx files, which makes this very convenient. This approach is more appropriate for small- to medium-sized projects. If you previously shared or had access to .snk files that included a private key, you should use .pfx files instead (unless you use delay signing).

Note   The AssemblyKeyFileAttribute has been deprecated in Visual Studio. You should use project properties or /keyfile instead.

Adapted from Microsoft patterns & practices guidance.
